Field.Label: Beacon can receive HTTP updates from multiple sources. It's primarily designed for Geohopper, Geofancy and Beecon.
Create device
Field.Description: Automatically create device if it doesn't exist

Field.Label: Geohopper uses HTTP PUT to send JSON formatted updates. You need to make sure your server is reachable from the Internet on the TCP port above for this to work. The Geohopper Web Service needs to be configured to use http://your-server:port.
Geofancy uses HTTP PUT to send www-form-urlencoded updates. The Geofancy Web Service needs to be configured to use http://your-server:port.
Geofency uses HTTP PUT to send JSON formatted updates. The Geofency Web Service needs to be configured to use http://your-server:port.
Beecon uses HTTP PUT to send a query to the webserver. The Beecon Call URL needs to be configured to use http://your-server:port.
Custom application
Field.Description: Custom application capable of HTTP POST (Content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded)
